instructions.en:
Step 1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees. Cut the bell peppers lengthwise, remove the seeds and stems. Lightly oil the bell peppers by tossing them in a bowl with some grapeseed oil or olive oil. Place the peppers on a baking sheet skin-side down. Roast in the oven for 8-10 minutes until the edges begin to show some color. Remove from the oven and allow to cool.
Step 2: While the peppers are roasting, prepare your stuffing. Place the cream cheese, walnuts, garlic, salt, sriracha and black pepper in a bowl and mix until creamy (I used a fork to mash the ingredients together but Im sure this can be done in a food processor or mixer). Add the green onion and fold in to the cream cheese until combined. Test the cream cheese for flavor. If you would like, add more salt and/or sriracha.
Step 3: Heat your oven to 400 degrees. Use a spoon (or a piping bag) to stuff the peppers liberally and place them back on the baking sheet. There is enough stuffing here to really pack those suckers up, so you dont need to worry about the amount of cream cheese youre portioning out. If the cream cheese is very soft, place the baking sheet in the refrigerator for 15 minutes to allow it to set up. If not, place pop the peppers in the oven and bake about 8 minutes. Change oven setting to high broil and bake an additional 2 minutes, until the tops of the cream cheese begin to brown (If theyre already brown at this point, skip the broiling).
Step 4: Put on a pretty plate and serve to your friends.
zh: 步驟1：將烤箱預熱至350度。縱向切薄片，去除種子和莖。用一些葡萄籽油或橄欖油將辣椒扔在碗中，輕輕油脂。將辣椒放在烤盤上的皮膚側。在烤箱中烤8-10分鐘，直到邊緣開始顯示一些顏色。從烤箱中取出，冷卻。
步驟2：辣椒正在烘烤時，準備餡料。將奶油奶酪，核桃，大蒜，鹽，sriracha和黑胡椒放在碗中，然後混合直至奶油（我用叉子將食材搗碎在一起，但我敢肯定可以在食品加工機或攪拌機中完成）。加入綠色洋蔥，然後將其折疊到奶油奶酪中，直至混合。測試奶油奶酪的味道。如果願意，請添加更多鹽和/或Sriracha。
步驟3：將烤箱加熱到400度。用勺子（或管道袋）將辣椒自由地塞入烤盤上。這裡有足夠的餡料來真正打包那些吸盤，因此您不必擔心奶油奶酪的數量，您會分配。如果奶油奶酪非常柔軟，請將烤盤放在冰箱中15分鐘，以使其設置。如果不是，請將辣椒彈出放入烤箱中，然後烘烤約8分鐘。將烤箱設置為高烤肉，再烘烤2分鐘，直到奶油奶酪的頂部開始變成褐色（如果此時它們已經變成褐色，請跳過烤肉）。
步驟4：放在漂亮的盤子上，給您的朋友。

en: Step 1: Roast Chili Peppers Preheat broiler.
Step 2: Select firm, meaty peppers without wrinkles for roasting.
Step 3: Wash thoroughly.
Step 4: Place peppers evenly in a single layer on a foil-lined cookie sheet.
Step 5: Place under broiler.
Step 6: Watch them closely as the skin will blister and turn black within minutes.
Step 7: Turn the peppers after 5 minutes to blister all sides evenly.
Step 8: When done, the pepper skins should be evenly blistered and mostly black.
Step 9: Place roasted peppers in a plastic bag, cover with a kitchen towel and when cool, rub off blackened skin.
Step 10: Tear open and pull out the seed pod and stem.
Step 11: Sauce In a blender combine the peppers, flour, and half of the suero or buttermilk and blend until creamy.
Step 12: Pour mixture into medium skillet and set over medium-low heat to warm.
Step 13: Add additional suero or buttermilk and stir.
Step 14: Taste and season with salt, usually about 2 teaspoons.
Step 15: If the sauce is too spicy, add cup of crema or sour cream and stir.
Step 16: If the sauce is too thick, add water until desired consistency is reached.
Step 17: Chicken (Optional) In a pot with enough water to cover, boil chicken breasts 25 minutes or until juices run clear.
Step 18: Drain, cool, and shred.
Step 19: Optional time-saver: shred a store bought rotisserie chicken.
Step 20: Stacked Style Fry tortillas in hot oil until softened.
Step 21: Drain on paper towels.
Step 22: Soften tortillas by soaking in sauce one at a time.
Step 23: Place softened tortillas on individual serving plates.
Step 24: Layer with cooked chicken, cheese, and onion.
Step 25: Repeat process for a total of 3 tortillas for each serving.
Step 26: Oven Style Preheat oven to 350 degrees.
Step 27: Spread 1 cup of the sauce in an ungreased 9-by-13-inch baking dish.
Step 28: Fry tortillas in hot oil just until softened.
Step 29: Drain on paper towels.
Step 30: Fill with cooked chicken, cheese, and onion.
Step 31: Roll, placing seam side down.
Step 32: Pour 2 cups of the sauce over enchiladas.
Step 33: Sprinkle with crumbled queso fresco and bake until warm, about 15 minutes.
Step 34: Serve with a dollop of crema or sour cream and your favorite side dish.

Step 2: Caramelize the sugar in a skillet over medium heat until it melts and turns brown. Slowly add the milks to the sugar, stirring constantly until the sugar dissolves.

Step 4: Pour the mixture into 6 custard cups and place them into a baking dish. Pour boiling water into the baking dish so that the water comes halfway up the sides of the cups. Place in the oven and bake until set, about 35 to 40 minutes.
Step 5: Remove the custard cups from the oven and cool completely in the refrigerator. When they are chilled, place a dessert plate on top of each custard cup and invert. Serve immediately.

Step 1: In a small mixing bowl or blender, combine all of the ingredients for the balsamic marinade except for the lemon juice (balsamic vinegar, apple cider vinegar, 1 tbsp grapeseed oil, honey, dried dill, herbs de provence, salt and pepper).
Step 2: Whisk or blend until oil and vinegar are well incorporated and no longer separate.

Step 3: Place salmon fillet in a baking dish (I use a small casserole dish). Pour the marinade over the salmon and allow it to marinate for at least 15 minutes (or up to 24 hours covered in the refrigerator).
Step 4: Turn your oven on high broil.
Step 5: Just before putting the salmon in the oven, drizzle the lemon juice over the fish.
Step 6: Bake for 10 to 12 minutes on the top rack or until salmon is glazed, browned and sizzling.
Step 7: While the salmon is baking, prepare the asparagus.
Step 8: Wash the asparagus and cut off the bottom inch and a half of each stalk and discard.
Step 9: Spread the asparagus on in a large skillet. Drizzle the grapeseed oil over the asparagus and spread the oil on the asparagus with your hands so that all stalks are completely coated.
Step 10: Sprinkle asparagus with desired amount of salt and pepper.
Step 11: Saute over medium heat for 5 minutes.
Step 12: Add the two tablespoons of vegetable stock and cover the skillet.
Step 13: Saute 4 minutes.
Step 14: Remove lid and add the minced garlic.
Step 15: Place cover back over the asparagus.
Step 16: Continue cooking an additional 3 to 5 minutes until asparagus is cooked but not too soft. Grate lemon zest over the top of the asparagus.

Step 1: Preheat oven to 350F. Grease and lightly flour 2 cupcake pans (24 cupcakes).

Step 2: To make the batter: In a small bowl, sift the cake flour and set aside. In a large bowl, on the medium speed of an electric mixer, cream the butter and sugar until very light and fluffy, about 5 minutes. Add the eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. In a small bowl, whisk together the red food coloring, cocoa, and vanilla. Add to the batter and beat well.

Step 3: In a measuring cup, stir the salt into the buttermilk. Add to the batter in three parts alternating with the flour. With each addition, beat until the ingredients are incorporated, but do not overbeat. In a small bowl, stir together the cider vinegar and baking soda. Add to the batter and mix well. Using a rubber spatula, scrape down the batter in the bowl, making sure the ingredients are well blended and the batter is smooth.

Step 4: Divide the batter among the prepared pans. Arrange the oven racks in the upper and lower thirds of the oven and bake the cupcakes, switching positions of the pans halfway through baking, until a tester comes out clean, about 20 minutes. Cool the cupcakes in the pan 10 minutes, then remove from the pan and cool completely on a rack before icing. To ice, mound about cup of frosting on top of each cupcake and use an icing spatula to make a swirl on top. If desired, decorate with colored sprinkles.
Step 5: Frosting
Step 6: Combine butter, salt, and cream cheese in mixer and beat on medium speed 2-3 minutes.
Step 7: Add sugar until just incorporated. Dont over mix. It should be thick but not fluffy.
Step 8: Add vanilla. If necessary, add milk to thin.

Step 1: Set two racks in the middle of the oven. Preheat to 375F.

Step 2: In a food processor, or bowl of an electric mixer, thoroughly mix the flour, cocoa, baking soda and powder, salt, and sugar. While pulsing, or on low speed, add the butter, and then the egg. Continue processing or mixing until dough comes together in a mass.

Step 3: Take rounded teaspoons of batter and place on a parchment paper-lined baking sheet approximately two inches apart. (I started off with loonie sized chunks of dough which was too big. Its more like the size of a quarter. Remember, youre aiming for 50 to 60 of these individual wafers!) With moistened hands, slightly flatten the dough. Bake for 9 minutes, rotating once for even baking. Set baking sheets on a rack to cool.

Step 4: To make the cream, place butter and shortening in a mixing bowl, and at low speed, gradually beat in the sugar and vanilla. Turn the mixer on high and beat for 2 to 3 minutes until filling is light and fluffy.

Step 5: To assemble the cookies, in a pastry bag with a 1/2 inch, round tip, pipe teaspoon-size blobs of cream into the center of one cookie. Place another cookie, equal in size to the first, on top of the cream. Lightly press, to work the filling evenly to the outsides of the cookie. (I dont think its entirely necessary to use a pastry bag. You could just spoon some icing on and squeeze between two wafers.) Continue this process until all the cookies have been sandwiched with cream.

Step 1: Place 200g of ground pork in a large mixing bowl.
Step 2: If preferred, pork may be substituted with ground chicken.

Step 3: Add 1 teaspoon of sea salt, 1 teaspoon of fine sugar, add 1/2 teaspoon of ground black pepper, 2 teaspoons of light soy sauce, 2 teaspoons of sesame oil and 1 tablespoon of Shaoxing Huatiao wine.
Step 4: Place 100g of canned water chestnuts in a chopper/blender.
Step 5: Chop the water chestnuts to small pieces.
Step 6: Add the chopped water chestnuts to the pork mixture.
Step 7: If preferred, use spinach or cabbage in place of water chestnuts.
Step 8: Add 2 to 3 tablespoons of finely chopped scallions or spring onions to the pork mixture.
Step 9: Combine all the filling ingredients well.
Step 10: Thaw the dumpling wrappers if they are frozen.
Step 11: Keep them well covered until they are ready to be used.
Step 12: Dust a dish generously with flour.
Step 13: This will hold the dumplings once they are made.
Step 14: Dust the table generously with flour.
Step 15: Carefully separate the sheets of dumpling wrappers and lay them on the table.
Step 16: Fill each wrapper with about 1.5 teaspoons of the prepared pork filling.
Step 17: Prepare a bowl of water.
Step 18: Dip finger into the water and lightly wet the rim of each dumpling wrapper.
Step 19: Bring the dumpling wrapper together till the opposite ends meet.
Step 20: Gently push the filling into the wrapper and pinch the top tip of the dumpling wrapper to seal it.
Step 21: From the centre of the dumpling, fold a pleat on ONE side and bring it to the other side of the dumpling.
Step 22: Fold towards the centre of the dumpling.
Step 23: Pinch to seal it.
Step 24: Repeat and create a 2nd pleat.
Step 25: Be mindful to pinch tight to seal the dumpling well.
Step 26: Repeat and create a 3rd pleat.
Step 27: Each side should have 3 pleats.
Step 28: Repeat the same pleating on the other end of the dumpling.
Step 29: Always ensure that the pleats face the centre of the dumpling.
Step 30: Place all prepared dumplings in a well floured dish ensuring that they do not touch each other.
Step 31: Set aside till ready to cook.
Step 32: They can also be frozen at this stage.
Step 33: To cook the potstickers, add 2 to 3 tablespoons of vegetable oil to a very hot frying pan.
Step 34: The potstickers should be cooked in at least 2 batches.
Step 35: When the oil is hot, add the dumplings ensuring that the flat surfaces face down.
Step 36: Pan fry till the bottoms of the dumplings are a nice golden brown.
Step 37: Add 1/3 cup of water to the pan.
Step 38: Cover the pan immediately and let the steam cook the dumplings for 4 to 5 minutes.
Step 39: Once the water has evaporated, remove the cover and let the dumplings sit in the hot pan for another minute for its base to crisp up again.
Step 40: These are now Chinese potstickers.
Step 41: Gently transfer the potstickers to a plate.
Step 42: Serve immediately.
Step 43: These Chinese potstickers are best served with a vinegar dip made with balsamic or black chinese vinegar and thinly sliced ginger.
Step 44: Soy sauce, chili oil or sesame oil may also be added to the dipping sauce.

Continue to cook over medium high heat until reduced to about of the original volume (should be slightly thinner than syrup).

title.en: Crispy Tiger Prawns With Honey and Garlic Sauce

en: Step 1: Blend cornflour and water until dissolved Add prawns, soy sauce, egg and sesame oil and mix well Combine honey & garlic sauce ingredients in a bowl and set aside Heat oil on high heat in a wok until the surface shimmers slightly Deep-fry half the prawns for 1 minute Remove with a slotted spoon and drain on kitchen paper Repeat with the rest of the prawns Drain the oil from the wok (you can save it for later in a jar) Wipe the wok clean with kitchen paper Heat the same wok to moderate heat and add the honey & garlic sauce ingredients Simmer for about 1 minutes Add the prawns till they are hot and just cooked through Garnish with spring onion and serve immediately.

title.en: Apothic Granita and Vanilla Panna Cotta

en: Step 1: Start with the Granita: Combine all ingredients into a medium saucepan over medium-low heat & simmer 10 to 15 minutes.
Step 2: Cool completely to room temp. Strain into a shallow airtight container; Cover & place in the freezer 2 hours.
Step 3: Take a fork & scrape the surface of the granita to form icy crystals (think of a snow cone).
Step 4: Place back in the freezer 1 hour. Repeat with taking a fork & scraping the surface to form more icy crystals.

Step 5: For the panna cotta: Heat the heavy cream, half-n-half & sugar in a saucepan over medium heat to dissolve the sugar; Remove from heat & scrape the seeds from the vanilla bean into the cream; Add the bean pod.
Step 6: Cover & let infuse 30 minutes
Step 7: Sprinkle the gelatin over the cold water in a medium-sized bowl & let stand 5 to 10 minutes.
Step 8: Remove vanilla bean from cream mixture & reheat over medium heat; Pour the warm cream over the gelatin; Stir until the gelatin is dissolved.
Step 9: Divide the Panna Cotta mixture into the 6 ramekins or large wine goblets; Chill until firm - 2 to 4 hours.
Step 10: Plating: Garnish the panna cotta with a couple of tablespoons of the granita with a fresh rosemary sprig.
